article.class: entry author-ron-usilton post-5401 post type-post status-publish format-standard sticky category-uncategorized archive-big

p.br: The Lake Forest School District believes it essential to provide academic resources and learning opportunities to our families during this time of closure. The above link will take you to these learning opportunities and academic resources. There will be two types of opportunities offered. The first are online programs that your child may access to practice skills. They will access the majority of these online programs through their Clever account. There are directions and a how to video on the site explaining how your child may access their Clever account. Your child will be familiar with many of these programs as they use them on a regular basis in school.

div.p: The other type of resource that will be provided are activity packets. These activity packets are considered a review of material learned throughout the 2019-2020 school year. Students can work at their own pace and receive support from family members. This work will not be graded.

We do realize that some of our students do not have computers or internet service to access these resources and activities. We are currently working on a plan to print out the activity packets and get them in the hands of our students. Further communication will be forthcoming about how these activity packets will be distributed for those that require paper copies.
Thank you for your continued support as we work to provide our students the best possible educational resources during this time of closure.

section.p: As the Lake Forest School District continues its search for the next Superintendent, the Board of Education would like to offer District stakeholders the opportunity to serve on its interview committees. Please use this application to provide your contact information for consideration. The application will close April 30, 2020. Stakeholders will be contacted directly if they are chosen as committee members.

p.img: Click HERE to view the 2019-2020 SY Grant Application for the Lake Forest Community Education Foundation. Submission Deadlines are as follows:

h3.span: 2019-2020 Teacher of the Year, Mrs. Christina Gallo

section.p: MRS. CHRISTINA GALLO has been selected as the Lake Forest School District 2019-2020 Teacher of the Year! Mrs. Gallo is a History teacher at Lake Forest High School. We are very proud to have her represent our District. Best of Luck to her at the State Teacher of the Year competition!
The FY19-FY21 Strategic Plan was approved by the Lake Forest Board of Education on May 24, 2018.
Please click the above Strategic Plan logo above to view the approved plan. The District would like to thank everyone for helping ensure we give our students unlimited opportunities and success.
Please click the image above to view the Lake Forest School District Emergency Protocols.
